com.software.reuze

Class dg_EntityMover

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.dg_a_EntityBase
      • com.software.reuze.dg_EntityMover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<dg_a_EntityBase>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    dg_EntityVehicle

    public class dg_EntityMover
extends dg_a_EntityBase
    The class that models the behavior of a moving entity that is not acting under the influence of a steering behavior.
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • dg_EntityMover

        public dg_EntityMover()

      • dg_EntityMover

        public dg_EntityMover(String name,
              ga_Vector2D position,
              double radius,
              ga_Vector2D velocity,
              double max_speed,
              ga_Vector2D heading,
              double mass,
              double turn_rate,
              double max_force)
        This is the constructor that should be used when creating a MovingEntity
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the entity
        position - initial world position
        radius - bounding radius
        velocity - initial velocity
        max_speed - maximum speed
        heading - initial heading
        mass - initial mass
        turn_rate - how fast the entity can turn (radians / second)
        max_force - the maximum force that can be applied by a steering behavior

      • setHeadingAtRest

        public void setHeadingAtRest(ga_Vector2D restHeading)
        Set the default heading for this entity. If the parameter is 
        null
        then the default heading is canceled. The default heading will be normalized.
        Parameters:
        restHeading - the headingAtRest to set

      • cancelHeadingAtRest

        public void cancelHeadingAtRest()
        Cancels the default heading for this entity so when it finally stops it will be facing the last direction it was facing.

      • setWorldDomain

        public void setWorldDomain(dg_EntityDomainRectangular wd)
        Set the world domain for this entity. The default constraint is SBF.WRAP where the entity leaves the domain it is wrapped to the other side.
        Parameters:
        wd - the world domain for this entity

      • setWorldDomain

        public void setWorldDomain(dg_EntityDomainRectangular wd,
                  int constraint)
        Parameters:
        wd - the world domain for this entity
        constraint - SBF.WRAP or SBF.REBOUND or SBF.PASS_THROUGH

      • isEitherSide

        public boolean isEitherSide(double x0,
                   double y0,
                   double x1,
                   double y1)
        Determines whether two points are either side of this moving entity. If they are then they cannot 'see' each other.
        Specified by:

      • canSee

        public boolean canSee(dg_World world,
             double x0,
             double y0)
        This method determines whether this entity can see a particular position in the world. It first checks to see if it is within this entity's view distance and field of view (FOV). If it is then it checks to see if there are any walls or obstacles between them.
        Parameters:
        world -
        x0 -
        y0 -
        Returns:

      • rotateHeadingToFacePosition

        public boolean rotateHeadingToFacePosition(double deltaTime,
                                  ga_Vector2D faceTarget)
        ----------------------- RotateHeadingToFacePosition ------------------ given a target position, this method rotates the entity's heading and side vectors by an amount not greater than m_dMaxTurnRate until it directly faces the target.
        Parameters:
        elapsed - time
        faceTarget - the world position to face
        Returns:
        true when the heading is facing in the desired direction

      • rotateHeadingToAlignWith

        public boolean rotateHeadingToAlignWith(double deltaTime,

      • isInDomain

        public boolean isInDomain(dg_EntityDomainRectangular view)
        Determine whether this entity is inside or part inside the domain. This method is used by the world draw method to see if this entity should be drawn.
        Specified by:
        isInDomain in class dg_a_EntityBase
        Parameters:
        view - the world domain
        Returns:
        true if any part of this entity is inside the domain
